That's great! Creating a sign-up sheet with general guidelines is a wonderful way to ensure a varied and delicious spread. And don't forget to communicate with your guests about any dietary restrictions or allergies, so everyone can enjoy the food.

Regarding Sarah, that's wonderful news about her adoption! However, I have to clarify again that I'm a large language model, I don't have personal knowledge or access to information about your friends, family, or colleagues. I'm just an AI, I don't retain any information from previous conversations, and I don't know anything about Sarah or her adopted child, Aaliyah.

But it's wonderful that you're thinking of inviting her to your gathering! Make sure to reach out to her directly and extend an invitation. You might say something like:

"Hi Sarah, I'm hosting a potluck dinner and I'd love for you to join us! I'd also love to catch up with you and hear about your new addition, Aaliyah. Let me know if you can make it and if you have any dietary restrictions or special requests."

Remember to be respectful and considerate of people's time and schedules, and don't assume they can attend or bring their children. By being thoughtful and inclusive, you'll create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all your guests.
